moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. c3
comment:
The opening
is an unusual hybrid of the King's Gambit and Italian Game. This experiment
does not succeed, but to refute it the inspired and amazingly vigorous play of
the young Pillsbury was required. An amusing fact is that White's last move in
this given position has not found its way into modern opening guides...  5...

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. c3 Nf6 6. Qe2
1. e4 e5 2. f4 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. c3 Nf6 6. Qe2 Qe7 7. d3 Bg4 8. f5 O-O-O 9. b4 Bxf3 10. gxf3 d5
comment:
Not losing an istant! Steinitz has
deployed his central and K-side pawns on white squares, and has advanced his
Q-side pawns onto black squares. This has led to the creation of "black holes"
in the centre and on K-side, and given Pillsbury the opportunity for
combinations.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. c3 Nf6 6. Qe2 Qe7 7. d3 Bg4 8. f5 O-O-O 9. b4 Bxf3 10. gxf3 d5 11. exd5 Nxb4 12. d4 Bb6 13. Ba3 Nfxd5

1. e4 e5 2. f4 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. c3 Nf6 6. Qe2 Qe7 7. d3 Bg4 8. f5 O-O-O 9. b4 Bxf3 10. gxf3 d5 11. exd5 Nxb4 12. d4 Bb6 13. Ba3 Nfxd5 14. Qe4 Nxc3 15. Nxc3 Rxd4 16. Qe2 Qh4+ 17. Kf1 Rxc4 18. Bxb4 Rxb4 19. Ne4 Rd8 20. Kg2 Rxe4
comment: An elegant finish, typical of Pillsbury.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. c3 Nf6 6. Qe2 Qe7 7. d3 Bg4 8. f5 O-O-O 9. b4 Bxf3 10. gxf3 d5 11. exd5 Nxb4 12. d4 Bb6 13. Ba3 Nfxd5 14. Qe4 Nxc3 15. Nxc3 Rxd4 16. Qe2 Qh4+ 17. Kf1 Rxc4 18. Bxb4 Rxb4 19. Ne4 Rd8 20. Kg2 Rxe4 21. fxe4 Rd2 22. Qxd2 Qg4+ 23. Kf1 Qf3+
comment:
Troughout his long career it is doubtful whether the first World
Champion ever experienced such a crushing defeat!     From "Miniatures from
the World Champions" by Anatoly Karpov - Batsford Ltd, London 1985
